choices.D: Add 2 filtering rules, with Rule 1 criteria as ג€name:testג€ and Rule 2 criteria as ג€status:onג€.
choices.A: Add 2 filtering rules, with Rule 1 criteria as ג€name:devג€ and Rule 2 criteria as ג€status:onג€.
choices.C: Add 1 filtering rule and combine the criteria ג€name:devג€ and ג€status:onג€.
choices.B: Add 1 filtering rule and combine the criteria ג€name:testג€ and ג€status:offג€.

questions.question_text:
The CTO releases a new company policy stating that all workloads need to be managed through vRealize Automation (vRA) so that access to day 2 operations can be controlled centrally through a policy. Prior to this policy, the App-Dev team deployed all of their 300 development and test workloads within a single public cloud vendor. The naming convention used for workloads is provided in the following table:
//IMG//

The App-Dev team needs to onboard all of the running development workloads into vRA and allocate them to the App-Dev project. The administrator creates a new Onboarding Plan and specifies the correct project and cloud account.
Which action should the administrator complete next to meet these requirements?

discussion.content:
It is C, since the question is about dev machines with status on. 
One rule with two criteria tags: https://docs.vmware.com/en/vRealize-Automation/8.1/Using-and-Managing-Cloud-Assembly/GUID-7378C2F1-1AA3-47BB-AB5B-9E0480893D35.html

Selected Answer: C
Answer is C since the quest asks for all dev VMs that are on. Answer D would give all dev VMs AND all On VMs
C should be correct as the ask is to onboard DEV VMs not test.
I think its B. Super Administrator can only assign the user Organization role associated with service roles. this can be done from Identity and Access Management

questions.question_text: When configuring vRealize Automation, which role should be assigned to a user who must be able to onboard other users and assign service roles to them?
Where would an administrator associate discovered networks from a particular region or data center in vRealize Automation to virtual machines?

discussion.content: definately C. just go create a new network profile and the 2nd tab (Networks) >> Add Network >> you can see all of the "discovered' networks under the column heading "Origin". and these, naturally are listed by column 2 == Account/Region. So the ans is C.
I think is C...where you address networkfor vm is within the network profiles

questions.question_text: Which integration option is available out of the box with vRealize Automation for deploying and managing Kubernetes resources?

discussion.content:
B
Tanzu Kubernetes Grid Integrated Edition (TKGI), formerly PKS,

comments.content: The answer should be B. When you change the version of vRA to 8.1 on the link you've pasted it is reffered to PKS. Tanzu Kubernetes Grid replaced PKS in later version (8.3 or 8.4)
No, it should be PKS , answer B

questions.question_text: Which command would an administrator run to access the logs for a specific service?

discussion.content: Tested, B is correct. Don't answer if. you have not tested pls.
I think the correct answer should be B
